item.text: Does the beneficiary have a condition that is a contraindication to receiving botulinum toxin?

valueCoding.display: An existing medical condition(s) which could affect the neuromuscular function
A hypersensitivity to any botulinum toxin preparation or to any of the components in the formulation of the serotype
An infection at the proposed injection site

item.text: The requested procedure is one of the following: Proposed frequency of injections.  Provider Note: Administration must not be given more frequently than every 12 weeks, regardless of diagnosis, unless specifically address in the policy.
Order Description: A request for injection of chemical (botulinum toxin) for destruction of nerve muscles (chemodenervation).

valueCoding.display: CPT 64612 - Chemodenervation of muscles(s); muscle(s) innervated by facial nerve, unilateral (e.g.m for blepharospasm, hemifacial spasm)
CPT 64615 - Chemodenervation of muscles(s); muscle(s) innervated by facial, trigeminal, cervical, spinal and accessory nerves, bilateral (e.g., for chronic migraine)

item.text: The medically necessary reason that supports Guidance procedure code CPT 95873 or CPT 95874 (if applicable) in conjunction with chemodenervation

valueCoding.display: CPT 95873 -Muscle stimulation guidance will be used during chemodenervation to avoid the documented structures that are adjacent to or behind the target muscle, reducing the risk of complications.
CPT 95874 - Electromyographic guidance for chemodenervation to avoid the documented structures that are adjacent to or behind the target muscle, reducing the risk of complications

item.text: If the selected ICD-10 code is not on the billing article allowable list, submit robust published evidence to support medical neccessity.

Provider Education Note: Specific information must be documented about the conservative methods of treatments such as medication, physical therapy, and other appropriate methods that have been tried and proven unsuccessful. The documentation must include an objective assessment of the intolerance or inadequacy of the response(s). (Excludes hemifacial spasm or blepharospasm)
Conventional treatment methods that have been attempted.  (Excludes hemifacial spasm or blepharospasm)
Beneficiary's therapeutic response to treatments attempted

valueCoding.display: 4 - Not possible due to the disease

answerCoding.display: CPT 64612 - Chemodenervation of muscles(s); muscle(s) innervated by facial nerve, unilateral (e.g.m for blepharospasm, hemifacial spasm)

item.text: The use of the selected serotype is not approved by the FDA and falls outside of treatment guidelines. Submit robust published evidence for this off label request AND the reason an approved serotype is not used.​
History of Chronic Migraines, select all that apply.

valueCoding.display: Headache disorders occurring greater than 15 days a month, with a duration of four or more hours, for a period of at least three months​
Migraine headache documented to be lasting for a duration ≥4 hours on a migraine day​
Headache occurs 15 or more days per month, at least 8 of the headache days per month meet the migraine without aura criteria, or respond to migraine specific treatment. ​
The beneficiary has significant disability due to the headaches and have been refractory to standard and conventional therapy.​
For continuing Botulism toxin therapy the beneficiary demonstrates a significant decrease in the number and frequency of headaches and an improvement in function upon receiving Botulinum toxin​

item.text: Medication(s) that have been attempted for chronic migraines with at least a 2-month trial.​  Provider Education Note: The beneficiary has had a trial of and inadequate response to a 2-month trial of at least one agent in any two of the following classes or has contraindication to the following medications.
Calcitonin gene-related peptide agent for chronic migraine prophylaxis is currently used.

valueCoding.display: Yes, and the beneficiary has had a reduction in the overall number of migraine days but still has chronic migraines requiring additional therapy for chronic migraine prevention.​
Yes, and the beneficiary has had a reduction in number of severe migraine days per month with CGRP use, but still has chronic migraines requiring additional therapy for chronic migraine prevention.​

item.text: Specific information is summarized about the conservative methods of treatments such as medication, physical therapy, and other appropriate methods that have been tried and proven unsuccessful.  Must include an objective assessment of the intolerance or inadequacy of the response(s).
